beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* reads xml from stdin * validates the xml (against an xsd) * writes to stdout
Validation failures are trapped and send to a discard file
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config exception-001.xml
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar
Once it is running it will wait for command line input
type something like this (valid according to the xsd) ...
<data>hello</data>
...and you should see it echo-ed
type something which is not an xml doc, or doesn't have an element called 'data' and the validation exception should be caught and routed to discards.txt

property.name: exceptionProcessor
property.description: this routes any exception to discard writer
